intro: Stillingia annua, commonly known as the annual stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia annua is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
